snippet.title: (OLD) Intruder in Antiquonia official teaser
snippet.description:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1778870/Intruder_In_Antiquonia/?utm_source=social&utm_medium=youtube&utm_campaign=teaser Play the demo!
http://eepurl.com/gE2Fy1 Join the newsletter!

In this classic point-and-click adventure, Sarah does not remember how she got to Antiquonia, but she has plenty of time to unravel the puzzle of her past as she explores the town where the Internet is not welcome. 

The story takes place in the present day, when Sarah is found lying on the road leading to the town of Antiquonia. After recovering, she is diagnosed with amnesia and must stay in the town to learn about her past. She will soon discover that the internet is not welcome in this town, a detail that will prove difficult as she begins to unravel the mystery of her past.

Antiquonia is a beautifully unique town heavily inspired by the Galicia region in Spain. Galicia has many beautiful towns full of soul and a proud history, and we have worked hard to capture this essence in the game’s art style and music.

Intruder in Antiquonia is a classic 2D point-and-click adventure game with high-resolution graphics designed by professional illustrators, a beautiful soundtrack written by an experienced composer, and a modern user interface.

CREATED BY
Silvia Izquierdo Pombo
Rubén López Gómez

DESIGNED BY
Rubén López Gómez

PRODUCED BY
Silvia Izquierdo Pombo
Rubén López Gómez

WRITTEN BY
Marcos Estebo Ortiz
Ana María Ponte Mujico

ART DIRECTOR
Diego Fernández Goberna

BACKGROUND ART BY
Jeneive Ho

CHARACTER DESIGN BY
Rusembell

INVENTORY ART BY
Daria Popkova

OTHER ART ART BY
Daria Popkova

ANIMATION BY
vungocduc
Rubén López Gómez
Lizartonne (Daniel Rodríguez Palacios)
Raquel Piay López

RIGGING BY
Juan Lara

MUSIC AND SFX
Juan R. Salgueiro Aguirre

LOCALIZATION BY
Carlos Hidalgo López
Myra Melcer

ENGINE BY
Rubén López Gómez

GAME PROGRAMMING BY
Rubén López Gómez

LOGO DESIGN BY
Jorge Fuentes

UI DESIGN BY
Jorge Fuentes

FONTS
Abisinia by Ruben Prol
Alegreya Sans by Juan Pablo del Peral
